name: Voices from the 50s Trivia Quiz | Music by Year | 10 Questions

questions.text: One of my favorite rock songs from the '50s was "Come, Go With Me". Who sang it?
questions.explanation:
Del-Vikings.

	All of the choices had hits during the '50s, but the song here was by the Del-Vikings. (It was, I believe, their biggest hit.)

questions.text: The Platters had many hits in the fifties. "All who love are blind" is a line from which of these songs?
questions.explanation:
Smoke Gets In Your Eyes.

	The lead singer, Tony Williams, had a very fine voice. All four of the songs listed were hits for the Platters, but the line in question comes from "Smoke".

questions.text: The Everly Brothers were popular in the early days of rock. Which song contains a reference to "lips of wine"?
questions.correct: (All I Have To Do Is) Dream
questions.explanation:
(All I Have To Do Is) Dream.

	Phil and Don were pioneers of rock. "I can make you mine, taste your lips of wine, any time, night or day" comes from "Dream".

questions.text: Two pretty songs from the fifties were "Come Softly " and "Mr. Blue". Who sang them?
questions.explanation:
Fleetwoods.

	All of these four groups had hits during the fifties, but the two songs mentioned were by the Fleetwoods.

questions.text: The best song by the Duprees may be "You Belong To Me". What city is referenced in the song?
questions.explanation:
Old Algiers.

	"See the market place in old Algiers" is a line from the song. (The other three choices are mentioned by Rick Nelson in "Traveling Man".)

questions.text: Jan and Dean had "cute" songs during the fifties and early sixties. Which was NOT one of them?
questions.explanation:
(It) Hurts So Bad.

	This song was by Little Anthony and the Imperials.

questions.text: Nat "King" Cole had one of the smoothest voices of the fifties. Which is NOT one of his hit songs?
options: Lazy Hazy Crazy Days of Summer
questions.explanation:
What Would My Mary Say?.

	This one is by Johnny Mathis.

questions.text: Johnny Mathis was one of the most popular (and romantic) voices of the fifties. Which song refers to "the magic of moonlight"?
questions.explanation:
Chances Are.

	All four songs are classics by Mathis, but the line in question comes from "Chances Are".

questions.text: Which of the following had a big hit with "(My) Secret Love"?
questions.explanation:
Doris Day.

	All four ladies were active in the fifties, but this song belonged to Doris Day.

questions.text: Which of the following sang about "a pocket full of starlight"?
questions.explanation:
Perry Como.

	The line comes from one of Como's big hits, "Catch a Falling Star and Put It In Your Pocket". (The other men were, of course, giants of the era.)
